title: Cross-stitching
description: I got into cross-stitching just before the pandemic, when I decided that I needed a better hobby than playing video games all day. Being able to create something tangible kept me sane during quarantine, and even now, I love unwinding after a long day by putting on a Netflix show and cross-stitching while watching it.
alt: A yin-yang cross-stitch design, where one half is a mountainous sunny landscape, and the other half is an ocean.

title: Baking
description: My love for baking started in high school, when I would bake to ward off stress before exam season. I have a sweet tooth, so it was great to be able to make something delicious to eat when I was stressed out. The image depicts a Russian dessert that I like; the name can be translated as 'the count's ruins.'
alt: A dessert where meringues are arranged in a brownish gooey substance.

title: Video games
description: Ever since I was a little kid, poring over the Professor Layton games on my DSi, I've harbored a love for video games. I'm not the best at any games that require a quick reaction time, so I prefer story-based and strategy games. Some of my favorites are the Ace Attorney games, especially the Great Ace Attorney Chronicles spin-offs, and Deltarune; the image depicts a pumpkin that I painted as the character Ralsei.
alt: Ralsei from Deltarune painted on a plastic pumpkin.

title: Spanish
description: ¡Bienvenidos a mi sitio web! I started learning Spanish in middle school and took it throughout high school as part of my IB coursework. Although I haven't been able to take many Spanish courses in high school, I remain fascinated by Spanish and Latine culture, especially coming from Florida, which has both of these cultures prevalent in its history. Side note: the image is of the Alcázar of Seville, from when I visited Spain with my family in 10th grade. As an avid - and former - Game of Thrones fan, being able to visit a filming location of one of my favorite shows was a fantastic experience!

title: Russian
description: Добро пожаловать на мой веб-сайт! As you can probably tell by my last name, my parents were born in Russia. Although they emigrated to the US three years before I was born, they raised me to learn the Russian language and culture, so I proudly identify as Russian-American. My brother and I used to go to Russia every summer to visit family and friends, and I feel proud to be able to identify with such a beautiful country. The image is of the Hermitage museum in St. Petersburg, one of my favorite cities in the world.
alt: The Hermitage in St. Petersburg, Russia.
